definition: to stop/to come to a halt
Buddhist monastery, temple or shrine (abbr. for 剎多羅, Sanskrit ksetra)
to live/to dwell/to stay/to reside/to stop/(suffix indicating firmness, steadiness, or coming to a halt)

sentences.english: He couldn't stop his bike. He hit the truck and fell off his bike.
sentences.chinese: 他沒剎住車，與卡車撞上了。

sentences.english: Therepairman slammed on his brakes. Jumping out, he saw the mangled bike.
sentences.chinese: 修理工剎住了車，跳了出來，看到嚴重損壞的自行車。

sentences.english: The word was on the tip of Jo's tongue to ask, but she checked herself in time.
sentences.chinese: 這句話已經衝到裘的舌尖，可她還是及時剎住了。

sentences.english: The brake doesn't  grip the wheel properly.
sentences.chinese: 車閘沒有及時剎住輪胎。

sentences.english: He should not brake the car abruptly on an icy road.
sentences.chinese: 他不應該在結冰路上把汽車猛然剎住。

sentences.english: He braked his bicycle at the stop sign.
sentences.chinese: 他在停車指示牌前把自行車剎住。

sentences.english: Here's what the government has done to put the brakes on lending just in January.
sentences.chinese: 下面是政府僅在1月間採取的剎住放貸的措施。

sentences.english: U. S. have pointed out that gambling must be stopped firmly.
sentences.chinese: 大家都指出，剎住賭風一定要堅決。

sentences.english: The driller disengages the drum clutch and secures the drawworks.
sentences.chinese: 司鑽摘掉輥筒離合器，剎住絞車。
